intro: Raveniopsis steyermarkii, commonly known as the Steyermark's raveniopsis, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the undergrowth of rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
